Key Arguments: Misinformation and disinformation are subjective terms, as truth is often relative and changes over time.
Historical and recent examples (Galileo, COVID-19) show that what is considered truth can change, and governments can be wrong.
The government should not be the arbitrator of truth, as this could lead to chaos.
Individuals should have the freedom to decide for themselves what is true or false without government intervention.
The proposed legislation is seen as an insult to the intelligence of the public.
Notable Quotes: Who is to decide that? Human’s quest for truth is an ongoing process...
Remember Galileo Galilei who said the Earth revolves around the sun...
CHAOS is all we get if the Parliament passes this Bill. So please don’t.
Australians should be free to read any information online and decide for themselves what is true or false...
